-e ---
---
Uralic languages are clearly distantly related with [Eurasian](Eurasian):  

Minun nimeni on Adam  
my name is Adam  

The language family spread together with PIE either via Corded Ware or the Seima Turbino complex (or both):  
https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-018-1522-1  

[Pronouns](Pronouns)

all but two numbers align nicely with European languages.  
'5' is more closely related to Slavic languages where penta is reduced to n-less petaâ‹phiti.  
Interestingly '4' shows a similar abnormality as [Dravidian](Dravidian).  

Negation: nem, ei, Ğ°, Ğ°Ğ±Ñƒ, at
